docs.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, a typical bill for 10 days in a semiprivate room in a New York City voluntary hospital was $560. This year the bill is $841.90. Next year it is expected to be almost $1,000.

headline.main: HOSPITALS' RATES ARE RISING FASTER THAN LIVING COSTS; But Health Officials Expect Even Greater Increases During Next 12 Months HIGHER PAY IS A FACTOR Other Causes Are Expensive Equipment and Losses on Ward and Clinic Patients Hospital Rates in U.S. Are Increasing Five Times Faster Than the Cost of Living HEALTH AIDES SEE EVEN HIGHER RISES Institutions in City Expect Bills to Go Up 10 to 15% in the Next 12 Months

docs.abstract: survey shows hosp bills rose at 5 times cost of living in '60s with bigger rise likely in next yr; higher salaries, expensive equipment and losses on ward and clinic patients cited; Beth Israel Hosp (NYC) cited; illus
docs.snippet: Five years ago, a typical bill for 10 days in a semiprivate room in a New York City voluntary hospital was $560. This year the bill is $841.90. Next year it is expected to be almost $1,000.
